document_data.name: Billiam Straodwall
document_data.Personality: While Billiam was often doubtful of his works, he truly believed he was destined to be one of [[Faer√ªn]]'s greatest writers. He often lambasted himself with hurtful self-talk.
document_data.Abilities: He was often found writing in his journal, distracting himself from his daily duties.
document_data.History:
After the city of [[Elturel]] was pulled down from [[Toril]] into the [[Nine Hells]], in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, many Elturgardians fled their home for safer lands. [[Dara]] a priestess of [[Ilmater]], and [[Ghorin]], an elderly shepherd were two such individuals that rallied people to form a refugee caravan, en route to [[Baldur's Gate]].{{Cite adventurers league/Escape from Elturgard|3-4}} Billiam was convinced to join the caravan by the miller [[Ippon]] and her assistant [[Pal]], albeit only after they gathered materials for him to make travel journal to document their journey.{{Cite adventurers league/Escape from Elturgard|12}}

After the caravan finally made its way west towards Baldur's Gate, tragedy struck one night during the journey. Billiam was slaughtered in gruesome fashion, his throat slit and a strange marking was made on his chest in blood. The murderer was a secret [[cult of Zariel|cultist of Zariel]] who hid amongst the refugees, [[Vollis Foote]]. Billiam's journal included a heroic description of their journey, but ultimately stopped on the night of his death.{{Cite adventurers league/Escape from Elturgard|21-23}}
